How to find an API key?
How to get a shared connection link?

• Download the OctoPi image from here.
 • Flash the image to a microSD card using Raspberry Pi Imager or Etcher.
 • Edit the octopi-wpa-supplicant.txt file on the SD card and enter your Wi-Fi credentials.
 • Insert the SD card into the Raspberry Pi, connect the printer, and power it on.
 • Find your Raspberry Pi on the network: http://octopi.local or by its IP address.

• Open OctoPrint in your browser.
 • Go to Settings > Plugin Manager > Get More
 • Search for “OctoEverywhere” and click Install.
 • Restart OctoPrint when prompted.
 • Go to Settings > OctoEverywhere.
 • Click “Connect Printer”, then go to octoeverywhere.com, log in, and link your account.
 • Your printer is now available online via the OctoEverywhere portal.

• Install the Octo4a app on your Android device (official GitHub page: https://github.com/feelfreelinux/octo4a).
 • Open Octo4a and follow the instructions to install OctoPrint.
 • Configure the necessary permissions and storage access for Octo4a.
 • Connect your 3D printer to the Android device via USB OTG.
 • Start OctoPrint from within the Octo4a app.
 • Once started, open OctoPrint in your browser (from the device: http://localhost:5000 or via device IP on the local network).
 • Go through the basic OctoPrint setup wizard.

• Open OctoPrint in your browser.
 • Go to Settings > Plugin Manager > Get More
 • Search for “OctoEverywhere” and click Install.
 • Restart OctoPrint when prompted.
 • Go to Settings > OctoEverywhere.
 • Click “Connect Printer”, then go to octoeverywhere.com, log in, and link your account.
 • Your printer is now available online via the OctoEverywhere portal.

• Install Python 3.7–3.10.
• Open Command Prompt and run:
\n python -m venv OctoPrint
\n OctoPrint\Scripts\activate
\n pip install octoprint
\n octoprint serve
\n • Open your browser and go to: http://localhost:5000
\n • Complete the initial OctoPrint setup.

• Open OctoPrint in your browser.
 • Go to Settings > Plugin Manager > Get More
 • Search for “OctoEverywhere” and click Install.
 • Restart OctoPrint when prompted.
 • Go to Settings > OctoEverywhere.
 • Click “Connect Printer”, then go to octoeverywhere.com, log in, and link your account.
 • Your printer is now available online via the OctoEverywhere portal.
